title: Ancient People in Southern Africa Lived Alone for a Long Time
summary: Scientists found that a group of people in southern Africa lived by themselves for thousands of years until about 1,000 years ago. Modern humans started in Africa, but it's hard to know what happened inside Africa long ago because old DNA doesn't survive well in hot places. A new study looked at old bones from southern Africa and got DNA from them. The DNA shows these people were very different from other groups in Africa and didn't mix with others until recently. They were not a small group; they had many people. This helps us learn more about human history and how groups moved and changed over time.

background_read: This article talks about ancient people in southern Africa. Scientists used DNA from old bones to learn that these people lived alone without mixing with others for a long time, until about 1,000 years ago. It helps us understand how humans spread and changed in Africa long ago.
Article_Structure: WHO: Scientists from South Africa and Sweden studied ancient skeletons.
WHAT: They found a distinct population in southern Africa that was isolated until 1,000 years ago.
WHERE: The study focused on southern Africa, south of the Zambezi river.
WHY: To learn more about human history and how groups in Africa lived and mixed.

perspectives.description: The study reveals new information about ancient human groups in Africa.
